org.jruyi.common

Class BytesBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jruyi.common.BytesBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, IByteSequence, ICloseable

    public final class BytesBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, IByteSequence, ICloseable
    A utility class for building a byte array.

    The static methods get are used to get the instance of this class. If there are some instances currently available in the thread local cache, one will be returned. Otherwise, a new instance will be created and returned. The method release is used to recycle this instance into the local cache of the current thread for it can be reused in this thread before being GC'ed.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • get

        public static BytesBuilder get(int capacity)

        Parameters:
        capacity - the desired minimum capacity.
        Returns:
        a BytesBuilder object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException - if the capacity argument is less than 0.

      • close

        public void close()
        Releases this bytes builder to the thread local cache so that it can be reused before being GC'ed.

        The reference to this byte builder must not be used anymore after this method is called. Otherwise, the behavior is undefined.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface ICloseable

      • capacity

        public int capacity()
        Returns the number of bytes that can be held without growing.
        Returns:
        the current capacity

      • ensureCapacity

        public void ensureCapacity(int minCapacity)
        Ensures that this object has a minimum capacity available before requiring the underlying buffer to be expanded. The general policy of this method is that if the minCapacity is greater than the current capacity(), then the capacity will be expanded to the larger value of either the minCapacity or the current capacity multiplied by two plus two. Although this is the general policy, there is no guarantee that the capacity will change.
        Parameters:
        minCapacity - the minimum desired capacity

      • trimToSize

        public void trimToSize()
        Trims off any extra capacity beyond the current length.

      • setLength

        public void setLength(int newLength)
        Sets the current length to the specified newLength. If the new length is greater than the current length, then the new bytes at the end of this object are filled with 0.
        Parameters:
        newLength - the new length
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the newLength argument is negative

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes(int index)
        Description copied from interface: IByteSequence
        Returns the bytes starting from the specified index to the end of the byte sequence.

        If index is equal to length(), then a zero length byte array is returned.

        The method getBytes(start) behaves exactly the same way as 

          getBytes(start, (length() - start))
        Specified by:
        getBytes in interface IByteSequence
        Parameters:
        index - the offset of the first byte to be got
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the bytes got as required

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes(int index,
                       int length)
        Description copied from interface: IByteSequence
        Returns length bytes starting at the specified index. If length is zero, then a zero length byte array is returned.
        Specified by:
        getBytes in interface IByteSequence
        Parameters:
        index - the offset of the first byte to be got
        length - the number of bytes to be got
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the bytes got as required

        the resultant short value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if start is negative or not smaller than length(), minus 2

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(int start)
        Decodes the sub-bytesequence starting from start(inclusive) to the end into a String using the platform's default charset, and returns the resultant String. The length of the resultant String is a function of the charset, and hence may not be equal to (length() - start).

        The returned String is constructed in the way below. 

          new String(getBytes(start))
        Parameters:
        start - the starting index of the sub-bytesquence to be decoded
        Returns:
        the resultant String as specified
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if start < 0 or start > length()

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(int start,
                                  java.lang.String charsetName)
        Decodes the sub-bytesquence starting from start(inclusive) to the end into a String using the charset whose name is the given charsetName, and returns the resultant String. The length of the resultant String is a function of the charset, and hence may not be equal to (length() - start).

        The returned String is constructed in the way below. 

          new String(getBytes(start), charsetName)
        Parameters:
        start - the starting index of the sub-bytesquence to be decoded
        charsetName - the name of the charset to be used to decode the bytes
        Returns:
        the resultant String as specified
        Throws:
        java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException - if the given charset name is illegal
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the charsetName is null
        java.nio.charset.UnsupportedCharsetException - if the named charset is not supported
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if start < 0 or start > length()

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(int start,
                                  java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Decodes the sub-bytesquence starting from start(inclusive) to the end into a String using the given charset, and returns the resultant String. The length of the resultant String is a function of the charset, and hence may not be equal to (length() - start).
        Parameters:
        start - the starting index of the sub-bytesquence to be decoded
        charset - the charset to be used to decode the bytes
        Returns:
        the resultant String as specified
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if start < 0 or start > length()

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(int start,
                                  ICharsetCodec charsetCodec)
        Decodes the sub-bytesquence starting from start(inclusive) to the end into a String using the given charsetCodec, and returns the resultant String. The length of the resultant String is a function of the charset, and hence may not be equal to (length() - start).
        Parameters:
        start - the starting index of the sub-bytesquence to be decoded
        charsetCodec - the charset codec to be used to decode the bytes
        Returns:
        the resultant String as specified
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if start < 0 or start > length()

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(int start,
                                  int length)
        Decodes the sub-bytesquence starting from start(inclusive) to (start + length)(exclusive) into a String using the platform's default charset, and returns the resultant String. The length of the resultant String is a function of the charset, and hence may not be equal to length.
        Parameters:
        start - the starting index of the sub-bytesequence to be decoded
        length - the number of bytes to be decoded
        Returns:
        the resultant String as specified
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the start and length arguments index characters outside this byte sequence

      • getString

                                  int length,
                                  java.lang.String charsetName)
        Decodes the sub-bytesequence starting from start(inclusive) to (start + length)(exclusive) into a String using the charset whose name is the given charsetName, and returns the resultant String. The length of the resultant String is a function of the charset, and hence may not be equal to length.
        Parameters:
        start - the starting index of the sub-bytesequence to be decoded
        length - the number of bytes to be decoded

        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the start and length arguments index characters outside this byte sequence

      • getUByte

        public int getUByte(int index)
        Zero-extends the byte value at the specified index to type int and returns the result, which is therefore in the range 0 through 255.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the byte value
        Returns:
        the byte at the specified index, interpreted as an unsigned 8-bit value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index < 0 or index >= length()

      • getUShortB

        public int getUShortB(int start)
        Interprets the 2 bytes starting from the specified start index as an int value in the big-endian byte order, in the range 0 through 65535 and returns.

        Let a be the first byte and b be the second byte. The value returned is: 

          ((a &amp; 0xff) &lt;&lt; 8) | (b &amp; 0xff)
        Parameters:
        start - the starting index of the 2 bytes
        Returns:
        the 2 bytes starting from the specified start index, interpreted as an unsigned 16-bit value in the big-endian byte order
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if start < 0 or (start + 2) > length()

      • getUShortL

        public int getUShortL(int start)
        Interprets the 2 bytes starting from the specified start index as an int value in the little-endian byte order, in the range 0 through 65535 and returns.

        Let a be the first byte and b be the second byte. The value returned is: 

          ((b &amp; 0xff) &lt;&lt; 8) | (a &amp; 0xff)
        Parameters:
        start - the starting index of the 2 bytes
        Returns:
        the 2 bytes starting from the specified start index, interpreted as an unsigned 16-bit value in the little-endian byte order
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if start < 0 or (start + 2) > length()

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(byte b)
        Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified byte b in this byte sequence. If no such byte occurs in this byte sequence, then -1 is returned.

        This method behaves exactly as below. 

         indexOf(b, 0)
        Parameters:
        b - the byte whose index of the first occurrence is to be returned
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the given b in this byte sequence, -1 if the byte does not occur

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(byte b,
                   int fromIndex)
        Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified byte b in this byte sequence, starting search at the given fromIndex. If no such byte occurs after index fromIndex(inclusive) in this byte sequence, then -1 is returned.

        There is no restriction on the value of fromIndex. If it is negative, it has the same effect as if it were 0. If it's greater than or equal to the length of this byte sequence, then -1 is returned.

        Parameters:
        b - the byte whose index of the first occurrence is to be returned
        fromIndex - the index to start the search from
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the given b after fromIndex(inclusive) in this byte sequence, - 1 if the byte does not occur

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(byte[] bytes)
        Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified bytes in this byte sequence. If no such byte array occurs, then -1 is returned.

        This method behaves exactly as below. 

         indexOf(bytes, 0)
        Parameters:
        bytes - the target byte array
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the given bytes in this byte sequence, -1 if the target byte array does not occur

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(byte[] bytes,
                   int fromIndex)
        Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified bytes in this byte sequence, starting search at the given fromIndex. If no such byte array occurs, then -1 is returned.

        There is no restriction on the value of fromIndex. If it is negative, it has the same effect as if it were 0. If it's greater than or equal to the length of this byte sequence, then -1 is returned.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the target byte array
        fromIndex - the index to start the search from
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the given bytes after fromIndex(inclusive) in this byte sequence, -1 if the target byte array does not occur

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(ByteKmp pattern)
        Returns the index within this sequence of the first occurrence of the specified pattern. If no such subsequence exists, then -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the KMP pattern holding the subsequence for which to search
        Returns:
        if the given pattern occurs as a subsequence within this sequence, then the index of the first character of the first such subsequence is returned; if it does not occur as a subsequence, - 1 is returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if pattern is null

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(ByteKmp pattern,
                   int fromIndex)
        Returns the index within this sequence of the first occurrence of the specified pattern, starting at the specified fromIndex. If no such subsequence exists, then -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the KMP pattern holding the subsequence for which to search
        fromIndex - the index from which to start the search
        Returns:
        if the given pattern occurs as a subsequence within this sequence, then the index of the first character of the first such subsequence is returned; if it does not occur as a subsequence, - 1 is returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if pattern is null

      • lastIndexOf

        public int lastIndexOf(byte b)
        Returns the index of the last occurrence of the specified byte b in this byte sequence, searching backward starting at (length() - 1). If no such byte occurs, then -1 is returned.

        This method behaves exactly as below. 

         lastIndexOf(b, length() - 1)
        Parameters:
        b - the byte whose index of the last occurrence is to be returned
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the given b in this byte sequence, -1 if the byte does not occur

      • lastIndexOf

        public int lastIndexOf(byte b,
                       int fromIndex)
        Returns the index of the last occurrence of the specified byte b in this byte sequence, searching backward starting at the specified fromIndex. If no such byte occurs before index fromIndex (inclusive) in this byte sequence, then -1 is returned.

        There is no restriction on the value of fromIndex. If it is greater than or equal to the length of this byte sequence, then the entire byte sequence would be searched. If it is negative, then it has the same effect as if it were -1: -1 is returned.

        Parameters:
        b - the byte whose index of the last occurrence is to be returned
        fromIndex - the index to start the backward search from
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the given b before fromIndex(inclusive) in this byte sequence, -1 if the byte does not occur

      • lastIndexOf

        public int lastIndexOf(byte[] bytes)
        Returns the index of the last occurrence of the specified byte array bytes in this byte sequence, searching backward starting at (length() - bytes.length). If no such byte array occurs, then -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array whose index of the last occurrence is to be returned
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the given bytes in this byte sequence, -1 if the given byte sequence does not occur

      • lastIndexOf

                       int fromIndex)

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte sequence whose index of the last occurrence is to be returned
        fromIndex - the index to start the backward search from
        Returns:
        the index of the last occurrence of the given bytes before fromIndex(inclusive) in this byte sequence, -1 if the given byte sequence does not occur

      • lastIndexOf

        public int lastIndexOf(ByteKmp pattern)
        Returns the index within this sequence of the rightmost occurrence of the specified subsequence by searching with the KMP algorithm.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the subsequence to search for
        Returns:
        if the given pattern occurs one or more times as a subsequence within this object, then the index of the first character of the last such subsequence is returned. If it does not occur as a subsequence, -1 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if pattern is null

      • lastIndexOf

        Description copied from interface: IByteSequence
        Copies the requested sequence of bytes to the given dst starting at dstBegin.
        Specified by:
        getBytes in interface IByteSequence
        Parameters:
        srcBegin - start copying at this offset.
        srcEnd - stop copying at this offset.
        dst - the array to copy the data into.
        dstBegin - offset into dst.

        Inserts the specified bytes to this BytesBuilder at index.
        Parameters:

        bytes - the byte array to insert
        Returns:
        this object

                               byte b,
                               int count)

        Parameters:

        b - the byte to insert
        count - the number of the specified byte to insert
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if count is negative

      • delete

        public BytesBuilder delete(int start,
                           int end)
        Removes the bytes in a subsequence of this sequence. The subsequence begins at the specified start and extends to the byte at index end - 1 or to the end of the sequence if no such byte exists. If start is equal to end, no changes are made.
        Parameters:
        start - the beginning index, inclusive
        end - the ending index, exclusive
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if start is negative, greater than length(), or greater than end

      • deleteByteAt

        public BytesBuilder deleteByteAt(int index)
        Removes the byte at the specified position in this sequence.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the byte to remove
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is negative or greater than or equal to length()

      • replace

        public BytesBuilder replace(int start,
                            int end,
                            IByteSequence bs)
        Replaces the bytes in a subsequence of this sequence with bytes in the specified bs. The subsequence begins at the specified start and extends to the byte at index end - 1 or to the end of the sequence if no such byte exists. First the bytes in the subsequence are removed and then the specified bs is inserted at start. (This sequence will be lengthened to accommodate the specified sequence if necessary.)
        Parameters:
        start - the beginning index, inclusive
        end - the ending index, exclusive
        bs - the byte sequence that will replace previous contents
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if start is negative, greater than length(), or greater than end

      • reverse

        public BytesBuilder reverse()
        Causes this byte sequence to be replaced by the reverse of the sequence.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • setByteAt

        public void setByteAt(int index,
                      byte b)
        Sets the byte b at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the byte to set
        b - the new byte
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or greater than or equal to length()

      • update

        public void update(int index,
                   byte b)
        Sets the byte b at the specified index. This method behaves exactly the same as setByteAt(int, byte).
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the byte to set
        b - the new byte
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or greater than or equal to length()

      • toBytes

        public byte[] toBytes()
        Returns a byte array containing the data that this BytesBuilder currently holds.
        Returns:
        a copy of the data currently held in this BytesBuilder

      • getByteBuffer

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer getByteBuffer(int offset,
                                         int length)
        Returns a ByteBuffer backed by the byte array in this BytesBuilder. Its capacity is capacity(), its position is offset, its limit is (offset + length), its mark is undefined.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset of the subarray of the backing byte array
        length - the length of the subarray of the backing byte array
        Returns:
        a ByteBuffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the preconditions on the offset and length arguments do not hold

      • write

        public void write(java.io.OutputStream out)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes all bytes in this BytesBuilder to the specified out.
        Parameters:
        out - the OutputStream to write to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any IO error occurs
        Since:
        1.2

      • write

        public void write(java.io.OutputStream out,
                  int offset,
                  int length)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes length number of bytes in this BytesBuilder, starting at the specified offset, to the specified out.
        Parameters:
        out - the OutputStream to write to
        offset - the index of the first byte to write
        length - the number of bytes to write
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the preconditions on the offset and length arguments do not hold
        java.io.IOException - if any IO error occurs
        Since:
        1.2

      • read

        public void read(java.io.InputStream in,
                 int length)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads length number of bytes from the specified in into this BytesBuilder, or fails if there are not enough left (EOF reached).
        Parameters:
        in - the InputStream to read from
        length - the number of bytes to read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any IO error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length is negative
        java.io.EOFException - if EOF is reached before the requested number of bytes is read
        Since:
        1.2

      • read

        public int read(java.io.InputStream in)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all bytes from the specified in into this BytesBuilder.
        Parameters:
        in - the InputStream to read from
        Returns:
        number of bytes read from the given in
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any IO error occurs
        Since:
        2.0
